poem:
Title: In the Wake of COP28

The firmament of fossil fuels sputters,
in the manuscript of nations, I read their clutter.
From the dance of the US, UK, to Canada,
are they not the orchestra of this grand stanza?
Will the wind shift, will the sun save?
Transition awaits on the crest of a wave.
Speak, 135 voices, let your echoes impeach,
it is within tide's reach.
